text:
[Cites 
7
, Cited by 
0
]

Calcutta High Court (Appellete Side)

The Indian Penal Code vs In Re : Gopal @ Gopal Chandra Biswas on 18 November, 2024

 18.11.2024
 30
 sdas
 Allowed

 C.R.M. (A) No. 3943 of 2024

 In Re:- An application for anticipatory bail under Section
 482 of the Bharatiya Nagarik Suraksha Sanhita in connection
 with Karimpur Police Station Case No. 19 of 2024 dated
 25.01.2024 under 
Sections 498A
/
354B
/
376
/
511
/
506
/
34
 of
 the Indian Penal Code.
 And
 In Re : Gopal @ Gopal Chandra Biswas ..... petitioner

 Mr. Amanul Islam
 Mr. Sourav Mukherjee
 .....for the petitioner

 Ms. Sujata Das
 Mr. Asraf Mandal
 ....for the State

 1.
 Learned Counsel for the petitioner submits

 allegation of attempt to murder/outraging of modesty are

 embellished to falsely implicate him. Accordingly, he prays for

 anticipatory bail.

 2. Learned Counsel for the State opposes the prayer

 for anticipatory bail.

 3. We have considered the materials on record

 including statement of the victim lady. Her allegations with

 regard to outraging modesty are bereft of material particulars

 with regard to date and time. However, she states she has been

 continuously threatened. In view of the aforesaid

 circumstances we are of the opinion custodial interrogation is

Signed By :

SHANTANU DAS
High Court of
Calcutta
20 th of
November 2024
06:05:51 PM

 2

 not necessary and petitioner may be granted anticipatory bail

 subject to strict conditions.

 4. Accordingly, we direct that in the event of arrest

 the petitioner shall be released on bail upon furnishing a bond

 of Rs.10,000/-, with two sureties of like amount each, to the

 satisfaction of the arresting officer and also be subject to the

 conditions as laid down under 
Section 482(2)
 of the Bharatiya

 Nagarik Suraksha Sanhita and on condition that he shall

 appear before the jurisdictional court and pray for regular bail

 within a period of four weeks from date and on further

 condition petitioner shall meet the investigating officer once in a

 week until further orders.

 5. The application for anticipatory bail is, thus,

 allowed.

 (Gaurang Kanth, J.) (Joymalya Bagchi, J.)

Signed By :

SHANTANU DAS
High Court of
Calcutta
20 th of
November 2024
06:05:51 PM

In Re:- An application for anticipatory bail under Section

 25.01.2024 under 
Sections 498A
/

 of
 the Indian Penal Code.
 And
 In Re : Gopal @ Gopal Chandra Biswas ..... petitioner

Mr. Amanul Islam
 Mr. Sourav Mukherjee
 .....for the petitioner

Ms. Sujata Das
 Mr. Asraf Mandal
 ....for the State

1.
 Learned Counsel for the petitioner submits
allegation of attempt to murder/outraging of modesty are
embellished to falsely implicate him. Accordingly, he prays for
anticipatory bail.
2. Learned Counsel for the State opposes the prayer
for anticipatory bail.
3. We have considered the materials on record
including statement of the victim lady. Her allegations with
regard to outraging modesty are bereft of material particulars
with regard to date and time. However, she states she has been
continuously threatened. In view of the aforesaid
circumstances we are of the opinion custodial interrogation is
Signed By :

SHANTANU DAS
High Court of
Calcutta
20 th of
November 2024
06:05:51 PM
not necessary and petitioner may be granted anticipatory bail
subject to strict conditions.
4. Accordingly, we direct that in the event of arrest
the petitioner shall be released on bail upon furnishing a bond
of Rs.10,000/-, with two sureties of like amount each, to the
satisfaction of the arresting officer and also be subject to the

conditions as laid down under 
Section 482(2)
 of the Bharatiya
Nagarik Suraksha Sanhita and on condition that he shall
appear before the jurisdictional court and pray for regular bail
within a period of four weeks from date and on further
condition petitioner shall meet the investigating officer once in a
week until further orders.
5. The application for anticipatory bail is, thus,
allowed.
(Gaurang Kanth, J.) (Joymalya Bagchi, J.)

SHANTANU DAS
High Court of
Calcutta
20 th of
November 2024
06:05:51 PM

citations.case_name: The Indian Penal Code v. In Re
citations.raw: The Indian Penal Code vs In Re

suggested_precedents.full_citation: Arnesh Kumar v. State of Bihar, (2014) 8 SCC 273
suggested_precedents.legal_principle: Mandatory arrest not required for offences punishable less than 7 years
